title: Cake Saw, 2011-7-1, 1870s
markings: Marks "S.D.B. Brower & Son/ STERLING 925/ an eagle facing left in an oval conjoined with a lozenge with HD ?&B.
inscribed: "Meta" engraved on end of handle in cartouche.
provenance: Purchased by the dealer in Summer 2009 from a sale consigned by Devan Moisan, who received the cake saw and a Lockwood de Forest stool from an descendant of Lockwood and Meta de Forest, Lisa. Lisa was the daughter of Lockwood and Meta deForest's son Alfred de Forest.  Lisa was estranged from her family and when she died she left everything to her friend Devan Moisan.
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Foliate decorated handle, spade with serrated edge and pointed tip has engraved decoration of a scene with palm trees and a tent
